title.narrative: Reducing Preventable Deaths Caused by Malnutrition and Infectious Diseases

description.narrative: The proposed initiative will focus on reducing preventable deaths caused by malnutrition and infectious diseases for vulnerable families (especially children under 5) in rural areas of Kailahun District, Sierra Leone. While the project will ultimately benefit vulnerable children, especially under 5, implementation will target their care givers, including young mothers, PLMs, single mothers, fathers, and other vulnerable caregivers, as the catalysts for improved nutrition and health practices in their households. Given the gender disparities described above, women are the primary target because they face greater socio-economic risks and are traditionally the primary caregivers for children. At the same time, it is critical to include men in the project because they play important roles in breastfeeding, health seeking and meal consumption practices. The proposed initiative will directly benefit 1,890 people, including 375 vulnerable caregivers, including young mothers, PLMs, single mothers, fathers, and other vulnerable caregivers (300 F/75M), 1,500 community members (through sensitization) and 15 CHWs within 15 communities in three Chiefdoms in Kailahun District, Sierra Leone. Indirectly, the project will reach 11,340 people.
